reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Simply great, easy on the ball, reliable and trustworthy

reviews.title: Cash back scam
reviews.text: I purchased home insurance via Quidco in June 2018 because there was an offer of cash back. Have chased this several times via Quidco who informed me it just takes time. 9 months later got email from Quidco telling me skipton had refused to pay something to do with the terms and conditions. If I had been told 9 months ago that they weren’t going to pay I would have cancelled my insurance and looked elsewhere. I get 14 days to cancel but they get 9 months to refuse cash back. What a scam. Don’t use Quidco or Skipton if you want a fair deal.

reviews.title: Skipton with a professional company smile.
reviews.text: I have been with the Skipton Building Society in Perth for many years. The professional staff members are a joy to talk to and are so friendly. Always greeted with a smile and extremely helpful.

reviews.title: Approachable and caring service
reviews.text: We were very impressed with how helpful and approachable they were, we decided to renew our mortgage with them.

reviews.title: quick home valuation, very good communication
reviews.text: quick home valuation, very good communication

reviews.title: Amazing experience with SBS
reviews.text: I got a colleague Mortgage through SBS and the whole experience from start to end, me & my partner are first time buyers so never experienced buying a mortgage before. Everything was clear in the conversations and when we had any question's they were answered straight away, the process was really fast and we got the mortgage cheaper than we thought we would

reviews.title: Fantastic Mortgage Provider
reviews.text: We have recently taken out a mortgage with Skipton. Their communication with our Financial Advisor was excellent. We were treated fairly and fast. The mortgage we have has a good rate. I am pleased with the easy access to view the mortgage information. Communication and notifications for the first payment were excellent we knew exactly what was happening. Very happy and would fully recommend Skipton..

reviews.title: Really good company to deal with
reviews.text: Excellent and professional. Would certainly use them again

reviews.title: Straightforward and easy
reviews.text: We took out a mortgage through a broker and Skipton delivered the best offer by a long shot. They honored the timeframes they gave and the process was absolutely painless. The app is very easy to use to monitor payments. I have contacted their customer support for something small and had a good experience.

reviews.title: Great mortgage
reviews.text: Easy to use the app. It puts in in control

reviews.title: Skipton fixed rate mortgage
reviews.text: Excellent customer service products and mortgage was easy to apply for

reviews.title: Good company
reviews.text: Very quick and reasonable to deal with

reviews.title: Conspiracers
reviews.text: Dont trust lots of fatal errors will let you down never admit no matter how vital they dont care will let you down reiterate lies to all including F O S avoid .

reviews.title: Flexible and Sensible approach to lending
reviews.text: Our situation was unusual in that my wife worked for the family business and took a wage cut during Covid. Skipton looked at matters for us from a personal viewpoint - we felt like they considered us a people, not just number crunching. Overall an amazing experience with friendly people who care.

reviews.title: Total failure to do their jobs constant cut and paste mentality zero adjustments for disabled customers
reviews.text: Terrible just terrible toward diverse customers... Where to start! Firstly they don't understand anything relating to disabled customers. Managers don't even deal with complaints always front line customer service advisor teams instead. Front line staff in the contact centre clearly have no disability awareness training and the same for departments behind the scenes as constant failures to even look at disability needs throughout all dealings. Clear a customer financially ok but then faff about no end to avoid having to lend. Weeks and months of endless LIVING HELL stress with constantly being passed about and cut and paste generic responses no regard for disabled customers accessibility needs or circumstances at all. Clearly don't understand the Equality Act at all. Even told me to go elsewhere! What a disgrace. For a company that advertises when your money is in a good place so are you... Clearly not living up to your values! Treating customers as individuals would be a good start. Quite happy to give lots of money to Mental Health UK as their charity partner but have zero regards for the distress of their failure to make disability accommodations has on their own members and customers. Don't even include full information in the complaints when submitted and issue final responses before they even compile the full information. "This is our final response" only to then read down the page where it says if we have missed any information please let us know... How can you issue a final reply without even referencing the content of the complaint??? Or even having used the full information you were supplied with...???!!!! Shambles doesn't even sum this up. HR seriously need to start educating about disability and train their staff on what the Equality Act means. So sad as you would think that with a presence and perception to the public of local service they would do well.

reviews.title: Excellent !
reviews.text: Great service and advice. Couldnt have done more to support me at a very difficult time.

reviews.title: DIP granted but full application declined after 2 week wait for decision!!!
reviews.text: Vey unhappy and annoyed that it took two weeks for them to tell me they were declining my full mortgage application. Underwriter made assumptions that I was upsizing and therefore made the assumptions that my outgoings will increase because if this. Nonsense! My current home is over 100 years old and the new premise was a new build and no bigger than what I live in now so will be far more energy efficient. Also quoted unrealistic figures when trying to justify her reasons for declining the mortgage. My husband and I both have very good credit scores as we have checked this with Experian and our records show we never miss or make any late payments. I can't understand how anyone with a ccj or bad debt can get mortgages but someone with a good record can't. The whole process has been long, drawn out and extremely stressful. Avoid at all costs!!!!!

reviews.title: Loyalty is rewarded again and again
reviews.text: Constantly offering great rates and products for loyal customers

reviews.title: easy to use and great rates.
reviews.text: easy to use and great rates. Simple online website. Extra benefits for members are worthwhile and I have taken some up.

reviews.title: Long standing customer who has had good service up u...
reviews.text: Long standing customer who has had good service up until now. I renewed an isa bond which pays the interest monthly to an external account and worked fine up untill I renewed in March. Now the interest isnt showing and the online chat just says the admin dept are dealing with it and will take 15 working days. Really unhappy about it. If I owed them money on a mortgage it would be different I'm sure. Other than complaining does anyone know of the procedure for taking this further?

Sadly Accrington branch closed went into Clitheroe and one of the ladies Ann was someone I knew from my school class over 50 years ago! Also young girl Laura who is lovely. We are happy with Skipton very friendly informative and would highly recommend to family and friends

reviews.title: I had a twelve month fixed rate bond that matured w...
reviews.text: I had a twelve month fixed rate bond that matured while I was hospitalised I was unable to get in touch with the skipton, when I was eventually discharged from hospital I went to my local branch to give instructions only to find out that the skipton had second guessed my intentions and reinvested my money into another twelve months bond which is exactly what I wanted .I know that other banks deposit your money into a measly account paying a very low rate of interest but not the skipton ,they did what was best for the customer

The site and app are easy to use and I can do everything I need too online. I find it easy to open new accounts and renew them all online. Skipton offer a good range of different ways to save from easy excess accounts, to bonds, ISA's and save as you go accounts.

reviews.title: Excellent experience with Skipton Building Society
reviews.text: I’ve had an excellent experience with Skipton Building Society! Their customer service is outstanding—friendly, helpful, and genuinely interested in finding the best solutions for your needs. Whether in-branch or online, the process is smooth, transparent, and straightforward. Their savings products are competitive and well-suited for various goals, and I particularly appreciate their no-pressure approach when discussing mortgages or investments. The app and online banking platform are also very user-friendly, making it easy to stay on top of your accounts. It’s clear they prioritize their members' needs and maintain a personal touch, which is rare these days. I would highly recommend Skipton to anyone looking for a trusted and reliable financial institution.

reviews.title: I have a LISA with Skipton and has never had any pro...

reviews.text: Great customer service from the staff in branch making my fixed rate maturity easy and quick. Had a lovely chat with the staff who told me about my benefits being with Skipton

reviews.title: I’ve had a savings account with Skipton for many yea...
reviews.text: I’ve had a savings account with Skipton for many years, and in recent years opened an ISA. The process was so smooth and the staff so helpful. I also have the mobile banking app which is so easy to use

reviews.title: Cannot transfer funds, no customer service solution
reviews.text: My Husband has (soon to be had) a savings account with Skipton for 1 yr. He wanted to move some funds but the app said he needed to use his nominated phone (he only has one phone) however his phone would not let him enter the secure number. He called customer service to ask for support and they said they could do nothing as his only phone was not registered... To get his phone activated he had to take in photo ID to a branch, (as branches are closing) the nearest is central London and will take a 4hr round trip. Alternatively he can wait 3-5 days for a form and get his ID verified by a solicitor. Neither option are very modern or user friendly. He is now writing to the CEO Stuart Haire, [email protected] to complain about this unacceptable process which only became apparent when he wanted to move money and will now take approx 14 days to do and he will miss the deadline he needs to meet.

reviews.title: A clunky not so ethical building society
reviews.text: Has some great products including low value fixed savings, and reg savers, plus the app is easy to use. One of my accounts matured, but getting the money out required logging into the desktop and setting up nominated bank account.. for each of the accounts I had; 4. Took more effort than needed, and meant I received 4 paper letters to confirm the changes. They're powered by Barclays which has terrible green credentials, ill fitting for the ethics of a building society.

reviews.title: Overall.
reviews.text: At present they have competitive rates and a presence on my High Street.

reviews.title: Seamless, easy LISA
reviews.text: I had a Skipton LISA for a number of years, everything was easy to set up, the app was easy to use and navigate and when i came to buy a house with that money as the deposit the whole process was seamless.

reviews.title: Rewards loyalty and excellent to deal with
reviews.text: Skipton have rewarded loyal savers more than most banks and building societies over the past year, and have been a pleasure to deal with whenever I've needed to contact them. The product terms are often very clear and they provide excellent flexibility for savers. They are one of my favourite financial institutions andI'll remain a customer for many years to come.

reviews.title: Professional, helpful and decent without pressure.
reviews.text: Excellent advice given and time spent on investing for better savings. No intrusive or controlling behaviour just incredibly helpful, actually knowledgeable and professional from the call centre to the bank staff especially at Ilkley. Super clear communication and actively try to help you not just sign you up. It’s like having an accountant, investment advisor and expert all in one and you still don’t feel pressured. Been wonderful so far for my savings.

reviews.title: Great family society
reviews.text: Great value rates and always a friendly face if you need to speak to over the phone or in-branch. Efficient and quite technologically advanced for a building society, transfers usually only take a couple of hours. I also find them excellent for child savings. Just wish they had a Fairer Share like Nationwide!

reviews.title: Helpful staff, limited support hours
reviews.text: I like Skipton. It's a smaller building society with lovely, helpful staff and convenient branches. App and online banking are convenient, the app being functional but not perfect. Skipton sometimes offer competitive products, and their customer service is helpful. However, the limited hours that support is available is seriously limiting, as is the fact that bank transfers can only be completed Monday to Friday before 9pm.

reviews.title: Solid trustworthy company

reviews.title: Love my lifetime ISA
reviews.text: I've managed to save so much with Skipton. I can't thank them enough. I'm nearly at my goal deposit. The app is easy to use and I trust them as a company.

reviews.title: Fixed term savings
reviews.text: I have recently converted an obsolete savings account to a fixed term savings. The process was easy once I was through to the right person. I am also relieved to see Skipton getting positive reviews for their tree planting.

reviews.title: INCREASED CO2, INCONVENIENCE AND LOW INTEREST ...THATS GOOD!
reviews.text: (As per Skipton BS)! When you discover the account you opened only a few months ago is only paying three quarters the rate new investors are getting, Skipton say that's OK, because you can:- 1)Watch the website like a hawk for new rates 2)Phone up to make an appointment to get updated account (Can take 40 mins to get through). 3)Drive in spending on petrol and parking and increasing CO2. 4)Use your own time, and staff time, transferring to a near identical new account to gain a few pennies interest.(That's why you can't just call in and do it, but need an appointment ... The staff are too busy transferring funds to near identical accounts!) 5)Complete transfer to the new account. After this:- 6)Skipton bring out an account within a few months offering a better rate to new investors. 7)You repeat 1,2,3,4 and 5. 8)Skipton repeat (6) 9)You repeat 1,2,3,4,5,and 7 10)They repeat 6 and 8 .... And so on ad finitum! You lose the will to live and complain. They say:- It's OK:- You can watch the website like a hawk and phone up for an appointment to transfer to a new account ...... again!

reviews.title: ROBBING LOYAL CUSTOMERS!
reviews.text: Skipton's approach these days seems to be to constantly degrade existing customers accounts to ensure they pay less interest than they do new customers (Beware new customers, your time will come!). In the case of my ISA an account opened last year had been degraded to about 75% of the rate offered new investors! And account had already been changed by me last year because exactly the same had happened then! If you don't keep checking, you lose interest. If you do check, you waste time going in to "upgrade" account , causing inconvenience, and extra CO2 caused by extra unnecessary visits! They say they all do it, but compare Nationwide and Family/National Counties who have treated loyal customers fairly throughout. When it's re-opened, it's the same money as before, but change is necessitated by Skipton constantly moving the Goal posts. Come on Skipton, start treating long term loyal customers fairly. You wouldn't be there without us!

reviews.title: Simple online procedure and help at hand
reviews.text: I opened a fixed rate bond online and it was pretty simple - a couple of questions which were answered instantly via online chat

reviews.title: Lifetime ISA makes saving easy
reviews.text: Hoping to buy our first home, but struggling to put away much money to get the deposit. I heard about Skipton from a friend and now my partner and I both have a LISA and find it easier to put money away knowing the gov top up anything we save. It also stops us from spending it. The accounts were easy to set up and information clear to understand, on the few instances I’ve spoken to staff they have been knowledgeable and friendly. The app is also nice and easy to use.

reviews.title: Horrible - difficult to withdraw your own money!
reviews.text: If you ever need to withdraw your entire funds from a savings account at Skipton to buy a house, you'll go through hell and high water to get YOUR money out, even from a flexible savings account. They will drag it out 4 weeks or so and many many calls of absolute misinformation. First they tell you it is being processed one week. Two weeks later someone will tell you they need a letter from your solicitor to authorise a withdrawal of YOUR funds. Unbelievable! Their customer service is appalling with one person telling you it is being processed and then another putting a stop on the transfer to YOUR bank account and this will likely go on for 4-6 weeks. If you happen to be managing funds for someone with a legitimate legally recognised and registered Power of Attorney (with the Office of Public Guardian), well they refuse to recognise it even though months prior, they acknowledged it. They can't tell you what law they use to refuse withdrawal of funds, because clearly they are acting illegally. They will tell you that THEY will decide if purchasing a house by the account holder in the account holder's name is the right thing for that account holder. Really! Since when did the consumer entrust their purchasing power and freedom to a building society? Since when did we hand over that freedom? I don't recall they had the right to manage funds over and above the Lasting Power of Attorney. Stay away from this horrible organisation who think the consumer account is their money. There are plenty of other reputable financial institutions to choose from who operate more ethically and morally. Customer service and my review would be negative 10 (-10) if I could give such a rating here.

reviews.title: Maturing Online ISA Instruction Difficulties
reviews.text: After 5 year ISA maturing online account. Wanted to withdraw all funds including closing interest. Was very confusing online and tried for over 45 mins to get through to help desk. Left message for a call back and never received. Eventually through web chat I think I managed to get assistance. Obviously online account is not user friendly. A total waste of about 90 mins of my time Their current interest rates are currently uncompetitive but even if they were I wouldn't be using them again. A total waste of about 90 mins of my time

reviews.title: as good as any other but more personable
reviews.text: great customer service in all branches i have been to. know their products well too.

reviews.title: Excellent Building Society
reviews.text: Skipton have just launched a regular saver account for existing customers, paying 3.50% interest. This is an excellent rate. I have always found the staff at Skipton to be friendly and helpful. The app and service from staff are really excellent - it is easy to send a direct mail via the app, and I can see all of my former accounts and the interest rates. Everything is simple to use and well thought through.

reviews.title: Invaluable when not much choice out there
reviews.text: When searching for a way to save for a house 3 years ago, Skipton were one of the few offering lifetime ISAs. They have allowed me to save consistently and securely.

reviews.title: The Lifetime ISA is the Gift that Keeps on Giving
reviews.text: I have been a Skipton Building Society customer for over 3 years now, and it is without a doubt one of the best decisions I have made in my adult life. The first product I used was the Lifetime ISA. Without this account I would not be the position I am in right now where I can put in offers on properties to buy. The 25% interest applied to any savings is frankly incredible! The fact that savings in a Lifetime ISA can only be withdrawn (without penalty) for a first-time buyer mortgage or retirement has been fantastic as it has allowed me to commitment to saving for my future. Admittedly, without the penalty I may very well have wasted a significant proportion of my savings instead of securing it for my future. I will be forever grateful for this product from Skipton Building Society and I know that it has given me the 'leg up' that I needed towards being able to buy my first home!

reviews.title: Interest rates dropped through the floor
reviews.text: After being with Skipton for 3 years and the BoE rate drop the rates applied to the isa have dropped steeply.

reviews.title: Lifetime isa
reviews.text: An excellent product which sees the government reward you for saving by adding to your savings in line with the amount that you save up to a maximum of £4,000.00 per year for a set period of time within prescribed timescale. All money paid out when you reach age 60 years, ideal savings plan to benefit you at retirement.

reviews.title: Quit renting
reviews.text: Great way to focus on getting money into an account and it costs more to withdraw, provides a focus if saving for something like a first home

reviews.title: Lisa
reviews.text: A really great experience with Skipton. Fantastic from start to finish and helped me on the journey to owning my own house

reviews.title: Local

reviews.title: One of the few products on the market
reviews.text: Competitive rate with the other 2 products on the market for Cash LISAS

reviews.title: Lifetime Isa for first home
reviews.text: One of the few banks to offer a lifetime isa and make it easy to understand through their website. The ISA can be managed online and email notifications let you know when the bonus is being applied. Very good and informative bank making it easy for young professionals to hop onto the property ladder.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.text: Great service, easy to use and have recommended to various friends

reviews.title: They're one of the few that offer a Cash LISA
reviews.text: It's been a smooth process and due to the method of transferring the HTB to LISA i got 25% for the entire HTB balanced (which ended on the last tax year). Couldn't be happier.

reviews.title: Simple and Efficient
reviews.text: Skilton Life ISA was simple to set up, easy to deposit money each month and the HMRC bonus is instant for helloing first time buyers. The house value is limited to £250k for the U.K. on a help to buy but the Life ISA is £450k

reviews.title: One of the best interest rates out there

reviews.title: Lifetime ISA

reviews.title: The only company to offer an online cash lifetime ISA.
reviews.text: Reliable, unique opportunity to invest in a cash lifetime ISA to give people the opportunity to get on the property ladder or secure retirement.

reviews.title: Helping us where the big banks let us down
reviews.text: Skiptons did an amazing job launching the lifetime isa. At a time where house prices are higher than ever it has never been harder to be a first time buyer! Skiptons are giving us a method to cut through the pain and get into our first home quicker!

reviews.title: Great Savings Product
reviews.text: I have encouraged both of my children-aged 18 and 20- to open a LISA with Skipton this year. It is great to know that they will both be saving for a house deposit in the future and getting a great bonus. The easy online application helped a great deal.

reviews.title: Great advice and customer service
reviews.text: I have had really good advice from the Skipton. No pressurised selling, friendly helpful staff and they contact you if there is a better deal to be had.

reviews.title: Only Cash LISA on the market
reviews.text: its been smooth for the most part hoping to transfer in my H2B ISA soon.

reviews.title: Could do better
reviews.text: I never really got on with Skipton Building Society. I could not seem to get their online account to work, and I do everything online now so this is a huge annoyance. The staff in my local branch have always been nice and polite though so that is a positive. Unsure whether I'd recommend though, would depend on the person.

reviews.title: Skipton Building Society
reviews.text: I've never had a problem with Skipton Building Society yet. They are always very helpful whenever I go into branch and always try to help me get the best return on my money. I would recommend Skipton to others. The one issue I have is that I don't find their website very user friendly but if you live close enough or have transport then you can pop into branch.

reviews.title: Great sevice by friendly competent staff ,
reviews.text: We have had a saving account with The Skipton for 8 years , The company advise other options so you are always on the best scheme . The staff always competent ,knowledgeable and friendly . I wouls reccomend them to friends and famuily

reviews.title: Excellent service in branch
reviews.text: My branch of the Skipton maybe small but the service is really excellent. I love the 1 year saver account which I use to save for Christmas, very easy to manage with a good interest rate

reviews.title: Friendly and easy to manage
reviews.text: Fantastic service in branch makes it a delight to have this account with the Skitpon.

reviews.title: Helpful and clear staff.
reviews.text: Created a cash ISA with Skipton due to the competitive offer due to other companies. One of the most helpful meetings I have had with staff when setting up an ISA, and received a lot of clear advice about the investment I was making.

reviews.title: On-line Saver with 4% interest
reviews.text: I have been a customer of Skipton Building Society for the last 20 years and in January this year they brought out a fixed rate on-line savings account paying 4% interest for the first year. I think this is one of the most competitive rates I've seen for a few years. They are always very easy to deal with - either in the local office or when you telephone their UK based office. When I had to "wind" up my parents estate last year after their passing they were most compassionate and helpful. Every so often they have a deal on where they will do a free Will writing campaign, which I took advantage of last year. When the interest rates change on any savings account - they always write to you well in advance so that you can move your money to a higher paying account. I would recommend Skipton as a trustworthy Company to invest in.
